title: Jenwi
author: Jenwi
content: After the fuel subsidy removal.many people started converting their various generator to be gas powered. When the country saw their successes and bravity, they started a slow and steady increment in the price of the gas leaving so many with regret meanwhile deterring others from following the trend.One advantage of the gas is its inability to produce fumes and extends the lifespan and performance of the engine. But as a saying goes that every thing that has an  advantage must surely have a disadvantage. The disadvantage is that the qauntity and level of the gas can not be gauged or checked. Once the cylinder is epmty, the engine shuts down without letting you know. This has been the principal motive why vehicles are not using it since they can't see the level as not to finish while driving especially on a risky road.

comments.author: Jegileman
comments.body: Quote from: Jenwi on December 12, 2023, 10:26:39 PMAfter the fuel subsidy removal.many people started converting their various generator to be gas powered. When the country saw their successes and bravity, they started a slow and steady increment in the price of the gas leaving so many with regret meanwhile deterring others from following the trend.This was not about following the trend at that time but it was about the risk that is involved in using cooking gas as energy source to power the generator. I love the initiative because it helped reduce the cost of consumption of the generator which will in turn reduce the cost of living of every Nigerian that used that method then. Now the cost of gas has increased above the cost of petrol which the generators was designed to work on initially, this people will have to convert their generators back to the fuel powered one. They must have enjoyed that period but to me, safety of life should be priority over cost of living.QuoteOne advantage of the gas is its inability to produce fumes and extends the lifespan and performance of the engine. But as a saying goes that every thing that has an  advantage must surely have a disadvantage. The disadvantage is that the qauntity and level of the gas can not be gauged or checked. Once the cylinder is epmty, the engine shuts down without letting you know. This has been the principal motive why vehicles are not using it since they can't see the level as not to finish while driving especially on a risky road.Are you talking about the gas that was been used by those that converted their generators into a gas powered one or CNG that can be used for cars as substitutes to fuel? I have not seen in any place that cooking gas can be used to power cars and that it doesn’t show the level of the quantity of gas in it. Maybe you mean a different gas and not the one that was used to power generator when the price of the fuel increased in the past.
